text: Namsuru is a village in Kargil district of the Indian union territory of Ladakh. The village is located 88 kilometres from district headquarters Kargil. ==Demographics== According to the 2011 census of India, Hardas has 108 households. The literacy rate of Namsuru village is 48.70%. In Namsuru, Male literacy stands at 61.56% while the female literacy rate was 34.30%. {| class="wikitable sortable" |+ Demographics (2011 Census) ! !! Total !! Male !! Female |- | Population || 905 || 460 || 445 |- | Children aged below 6 years || 176 || 75 || 101 |- | Scheduled caste || 0 || 0 || 0 |- | Scheduled tribe || 893 || 453 || 440 |- | Literacy || 48.70% || 61.56% || 34.20% |- | Workers (all) || 239 || 188 || 51 |- | Main workers (all) || 74 || – || – |- | Marginal workers (total) || 165 || 120 || 45 |} ==Transport== ===Road=== Namsuru is connected to other places in Ladakh by the NH 301. ===Rail=== The nearest railway station to Namsuru is the Sopore railway station located at a distance of 305 kilometres. ===Air=== The nearest airport is at Kargil located at a distance of 94 kilometres but it is currently non-operational. The next nearest major airport is Leh Airport located at a distance of 301 kilometres. ==See also== *Ladakh *Kargil *Suru Valley *Rangdum ==References== Category:Villages in Taisuru tehsil
title: Namsuru
